notes_translated.fr:
Cet indice utilise les valeurs standardisées de la composante première de l'analyse des composantes principales sur l'indice de dépression des Aléoutiennes (ALPI), l'indice interdécennale de l'oscillation Pacifique, et les anomalies de circulation atmosphérique nord-ouest du Pacifique Nord (Décembre à Mars). Les valeurs positives représentent les dépressions intenses des Aléoutiennes, la fréquence supérieure à la moyenne du vent ouest et sud-ouest, la rafraîchissante de la température de surface de la mer, et l'échauffement dans les eaux côtières d'Amérique du Nord.

Citation correcte: Gordon A McFarlane, Jacquelynne R King, Richard J Beamish, Have there been recent changes in climate? Ask the fish, Progress in Oceanography, Volume 47, Issues 2–4, 2000, Pages 147-169, ISSN 0079-6611, https://doi.org/10.1016/S0079-6611(00)00034-3. [en anglais seulement].

Résumé: http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0079661100000343
notes_translated.en:
The Atmospheric Forcing Index (AFI) utilizes standardized scores of the first component from a principal components analysis on the Aleutian Low Pressure Index (ALPI), Pacific Interdecadal Oscillation Index, and the northwesterly atmospheric circulation anomalies for the North Pacific (December through March). Positive values represent intense Aleutian lows, above average frequency of westerly and southwesterly winds, cooling of sea surface temperatures in the central North Pacific, and warming within North American coastal waters.

Correct citation: Gordon A McFarlane, Jacquelynne R King, Richard J Beamish, Have there been recent changes in climate? Ask the fish, Progress in Oceanography, Volume 47, Issues 2–4, 2000, Pages 147-169, ISSN 0079-6611, https://doi.org/10.1016/S0079-6611(00)00034-3.

Abstract: http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0079661100000343

The Atmospheric Forcing Index (AFI) utilizes standardized scores of the first component from a principal components analysis on the Aleutian Low Pressure Index (ALPI), Pacific Interdecadal Oscillation Index, and the northwesterly atmospheric circulation anomalies for the North Pacific (December through March). Positive values represent intense Aleutian lows, above average frequency of westerly and southwesterly winds, cooling of sea surface temperatures in the central North Pacific, and warming within North American coastal waters.

Correct citation: Gordon A McFarlane, Jacquelynne R King, Richard J Beamish, Have there been recent changes in climate? Ask the fish, Progress in Oceanography, Volume 47, Issues 2–4, 2000, Pages 147-169, ISSN 0079-6611, https://doi.org/10.1016/S0079-6611(00)00034-3.
